midas/mxml/strlcpy.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003    Name:         strlcpy.c
00004    Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006    Contents:     Contains strlcpy and strlcat which are versions of
00007                  strcpy and strcat, but which avoid buffer overflows
00008 
00009    $Id: strlcpy.c 16 2005-10-07 13:05:38Z ritt $
00010 
00011 \********************************************************************/
00012 
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include <string.h>
00015 #include "strlcpy.h"
00016 
00017 /*
00018 * Copy src to string dst of size siz.  At most siz-1 characters
00019 * will be copied.  Always NUL terminates (unless size == 0).
00020 * Returns strlen(src); if retval >= siz, truncation occurred.
00021 */
00022 size_t strlcpy(char *dst, const char *src, size_t size)
00023 {
00024    char *d = dst;
00025    const char *s = src;
00026    size_t n = size;
00027 
00028    /* Copy as many bytes as will fit */
00029    if (n != 0 && --n != 0) {
00030       do {
00031          if ((*d++ = *s++) == 0)
00032             break;
00033       } while (--n != 0);
00034    }
00035 
00036    /* Not enough room in dst, add NUL and traverse rest of src */
00037    if (n == 0) {
00038       if (size != 0)
00039          *d = '\0';             /* NUL-terminate dst */
00040       while (*s++);
00041    }
00042 
00043    return (s - src - 1);        /* count does not include NUL */
00044 }
00045 
00046 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00047 
00048 /*
00049 * Appends src to string dst of size siz (unlike strncat, siz is the
00050 * full size of dst, not space left).  At most siz-1 characters
00051 * will be copied.  Always NUL terminates (unless size <= strlen(dst)).
00052 * Returns strlen(src) + MIN(size, strlen(initial dst)).
00053 * If retval >= size, truncation occurred.
00054 */
00055 size_t strlcat(char *dst, const char *src, size_t size)
00056 {
00057    char *d = dst;
00058    const char *s = src;
00059    size_t n = size;
00060    size_t dlen;
00061 
00062    /* Find the end of dst and adjust bytes left but don't go past end */
00063    while (n-- != 0 && *d != '\0')
00064       d++;
00065    dlen = d - dst;
00066    n = size - dlen;
00067 
00068    if (n == 0)
00069       return (dlen + strlen(s));
00070    while (*s != '\0') {
00071       if (n != 1) {
00072          *d++ = *s;
00073          n--;
00074       }
00075       s++;
00076    }
00077    *d = '\0';
00078 
00079    return (dlen + (s - src));   /* count does not include NUL */
00080 }
00081 
00082 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
